items.title: [Feature Request] International Standard Recording Code (ISRC) Compatibility
items.body:
Unless I missed it while searching the documentation, I don't see any support for an 'ISRC' tag for audio files.

It appears under ID3v2 frame specification on the [ID3 wiki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ID3) as a 'TSRC' frame.

Also [here on the ISRC wiki page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Standard_Recording_Code#Embedding_ISRC_in_files)

Thanks!

items.title: tag.clear() + tag.save() fails
items.body:
Small issue,
Using Python3.8, when modifying the tags by clearing them using tag.clear() it removes all the tag data including the tag.file_info.name, which subsequently prevents you from doing a tag.save() without specifying the filename.

In order to resolve this, we have to first save the filename (fname = audio.tag.file_info.name) and then doing audio.tag.save(fname)

With this being said, after you do a clear because it deletes the attributes of file_info, I have not found the way to put the attributes back on to file_info (attributes like  file_info.name). I noticed when doing help(audio.tag.save) the help function says that if 'filename' is not given that it will use the value from file_info. If it clears that data it will throw the exception.

Could you modify the clear() function so that when it clears the file_info it recreates the attribute structure (and possibly other structures commonly used). If it's recreated, then we can do audio.tag.file_info.name = "/user/mrhobbits/my_song.mp3"
If we try to do that now we get the error "AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'name'

items.title: Set MEDIA year
items.body: eyeD3 sets -Y as release year, however most readers like windows file explorer, serato dj, use and display the media year, not release year. How can we write to this tag?

Alex

items.title: Crash when updating email frame due to bad encode() call
items.body:
Line 956 in frames.py:

    self._email = email.encode(ascii_encode)

This fails because ascii_encode is a function and the encode() function expects a string.  I believe the following should work:

    self._email = email.encode('ascii')

Now, whenever I try to run a CLI command, even `eyed3 -- help`, my console outputs nothing. Same thing if I try to output file info with `eyed3 file.mp3`

This happened both with a virtualenv and without.

Setup:
- macOs
- Python 3.7.4
- pip 20.0.2

items.body:
Hello,
with commit [bbfd1bd](https://github.com/nicfit/eyeD3/commit/bbfd1bd874a96dc130aa78a0dfb45bbd4914410e) a typo in line [361](https://github.com/nicfit/eyeD3/blob/52d61e95b337d2c8d5f3661f4137b81dafb2ab31/eyed3/utils/__init__.py#L361) causes a Syntax Error when called:

```python
Traceback (most recent call last):
    import eyed3
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/eyed3/__init__.py", line 30, in 
    from .utils.log import log                                          # noqa: E402
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/eyed3/utils/__init__.py", line 361
    msg = f"invalid level choice: {level} (choose from {parser.log_levels})"
           ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax
```
eyed3 was installed and upgraded via pip in a fresh Debian Buster.

EDIT: I have simulated this with an Ubuntu 18.04 and attached a log.
[errorlog.txt](https://github.com/nicfit/eyeD3/files/4027482/errorlog.txt)

Regards,
Matthias

items.title: Why are you removing versions?
items.body: I noticed that you have been removing versions on pypi.org since 2019/12/29. On 12/29, you removed version 0.8.7. On 01/02, you removed version 0.8.8. Can you let me know why you are removing the existing versions?

items.title: LameInfo with debug info
items.body:
I need this command in python code:
```
eyeD3 -P lameinfo path/to/file.mp3 -l debug
```

But I can't figure out how to use the LameInfoPlugin. I can't find any documentation on how to use plugins other than the API [here](https://eyed3.readthedocs.io/en/latest/eyed3.plugins.html).

Also, is there a way to turn on debug mode in python for this?

Tiny example code that does the above would be super appreciated

items.title: `application/x-font-gdos` is sometimes returned as a .mp3 mime-type and it not in the list of acceptable types
items.body:
I have directory of songs, they all look like " Noisia-Tommy+s_Theme.mp3". I wrote a script to automatically tag the artist and the title for each of them.
```
#!/usr/bin/env python3

import eyed3
import os

os.chdir("./")
for filename in os.listdir('./'):
    for c, s in enumerate(filename):
            if s=="-":
                artist=filename[:(c)]
                title=filename[(c+1):-4]
                audiofile=eyed3.load(filename)
                audiofile.initTag()
                artist=artist.replace("+", "'")
                artist=artist.replace("_", " ")
                title=title.replace("+", "'")
                title=title.replace("_", " ")
                print(title)
                print(artist)
                audiofile.tag.artist=artist
                audiofile.tag.title=title
                audiofile.tag.save()
                break 
```  

When I run it I get this error : ``Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./tag.py", line 14, in <module>
    audiofile.initTag()
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'initTag'``
 But it happens only with 1/3 of the files. It works for some songs, but not for all of them. Any advices? ``

items.title: UnboundLocalError: local variable 'tn' referenced before assignment
items.body:
So I was using eyeD3 ( python ) to set ID3 tags to mp3 files for a personal project when the given traceback occurred in ```eyed3/id3/tag.py``` As a temporary hack I changed _setNum(self, fid, val) on line 320 in the said file as follows:

```python3  
def _setNum(self, fid, val):
        tn, tt = None, None # Added this line 
        if type(val) is tuple:
            tn, tt = val
        elif type(val) is int:
            tn, tt = val, None
        elif val is None:
            tn, tt = None, None

        n = (tn, tt)
```
Although the UnboundLocalError was gone but the track number tag was not being assigned properly (I didn't expect to either) hence this issue for hopefully a proper fix (or guidance so that I can fix it myself and open a PR)

items.title: owner_id typed as string and uniq_id being typed as list
items.body:
I don't know the underlying reasons of why this has been done like that, but under certain conditions, when I try to make a modification to a file that I have, the method render of the class UniqueFileIDFrame fails due to the above listed problems. I ran the following script:

```
#!/usr/local/bin/python3.8

import eyed3

audiofile = eyed3.load("happydays.mp3")
audiofile.tag.title = "01 - " + audiofile.tag.title

audiofile.tag.save()

```
And the result was:

```
Invalid UFID, owner_id is empty. Setting to 'http://www.id3.org/dummy/ufid.html'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./testjp.py", line 8, in <module>
    audiofile.tag.save()
  File "/home/gabriel/Projects/eyeD3/src/eyed3/id3/tag.py", line 823, in save
    self._saveV2Tag(version, encoding, max_padding)
  File "/home/gabriel/Projects/eyeD3/src/eyed3/id3/tag.py", line 1027, in _saveV2Tag
    rewrite_required, tag_data, padding = self._render(version,
  File "/home/gabriel/Projects/eyeD3/src/eyed3/id3/tag.py", line 945, in _render
    raw_frame = f.render()
  File "/home/gabriel/Projects/eyeD3/src/eyed3/id3/frames.py", line 1035, in render
    self.data = self.owner_id + b"\x00" + self.uniq_id
```

You can see that the string 'http://www.id3.org/dummy/ufid.html' should have rather being b'http://www.id3.org/dummy/ufid.html' because it need to be concatenated to another byte array later, besides that, even after if this is fixed, the uniq_id is a list instead of another byte array, so joining it should solve at least this issue.

I have a patch that solves this issue here:

```
diff --git a/src/eyed3/id3/frames.py b/src/eyed3/id3/frames.py
index e48f82c..771446f 100644
--- a/src/eyed3/id3/frames.py
+++ b/src/eyed3/id3/frames.py
@@ -1021,7 +1021,7 @@ class UniqueFileIDFrame(Frame):
         log.debug("UFID owner_id: %s" % self.owner_id)
         log.debug("UFID id: %s" % self.uniq_id)
         if len(self.owner_id) == 0:
-            dummy_owner_id = "http://www.id3.org/dummy/ufid.html"
+            dummy_owner_id = b"http://www.id3.org/dummy/ufid.html"
             self.owner_id = dummy_owner_id
             core.parseError(FrameException("Invalid UFID, owner_id is empty. "
                                            "Setting to '%s'" % dummy_owner_id))
@@ -1030,7 +1030,7 @@ class UniqueFileIDFrame(Frame):
                                            "long: %s" % self.uniq_id))
 
     def render(self):
-        self.data = self.owner_id + b"\x00" + self.uniq_id
+        self.data = self.owner_id + b"\x00" + b''.join(self.uniq_id)
         return super(UniqueFileIDFrame, self).render()

```
Unfortunately I coudn't find a way to upload the mp3 file used for the test. Anyone wanting it, just share it with me.

Regards,
Gabriel

EDIT: I created a pull request for this issue.

items.title: File "magic" for contents fails when id3v2.4 tag frame length 512 - 521 inclusive
items.body:
python version  3.5.2
mutagen version 1.41.1
eyeD3 version 0.8.8

When using the "file" command with a clean (non-tagged) MP3 file, one sees eg

X.mp3: MPEG ADTS, layer III, v1, 128 kbps, 44.1 kHz, JntStereo

and with an eyeD3 v2.4 tagged file, one usually (most cases) sees

X.mp3: Audio file with ID3 version 2.4.0, contains: MPEG ADTS, layer III, v1, 128 kbps, 44.1 kHz, JntStereo

The identification of the file contents as MPEG audio is essential for software which relies on "magic" to identify valid MP3 files, eg dircast which uses python-magic and creates XML lists of valid MP3 files.

However I have discovered that when eyeD3 creates an id3v2.4 tag whose length is 512 - 521 inclusive (using guessmp3enc to determine the value), "file" only reports

X.mp3: Audio file with ID3 version 2.4.0

and does not recognize the MPEG contents.

This arises when the total string length of the tags is between certain values - a range of 11 characters length.

If one of the tags (eg the URL tag, usually the longest) is not included in the initial tagging and is applied on its own on a subsequent application of eyeD3 then the problem does not occur.

What is bizarre about this is that the length of the id3tag header (now less than 512 remains unchanged after the URL tag is applied (and is verified as being present).

These observations would suggest that  perhaps there is a padding issue and if so, a bug in the calculation of the sizes needed.

I attach a Bourne shell script which illustrates the issue in two scenarios -one with multiple tags, and the simple case of just a title tag, which should work with any valid test MP3 file
named XX.mp3 in the current directory, except even when the file is named tagger.txt it refuses to upload. [Must be a new MicroSloth feature of Github and now Preview is broken as well.]

So instead it is on PasteBin at

https://pastebin.com/ehh1n8wC

items.title: Don't overwrite logging.basicConfig
items.body: In .utils.log, `basicConfig()` from the `logging` module is called without parameters, setting the default logging stream to `stderr`. This is not recommended practice, and on top of that, highly annoying if one uses their own configuration.

items.title: eyeD3 doesn't save images with UTF8 encoding when description is empty
items.body:
I tried saving an image using the python module to ID3_V2_4 using UTF8, all the fields are saved with UTF8 except for the image field. The image field is saved using ISO-8859-1
Here's a sample code to reproduce the problem:
```python
FRONT_COVER = eyed3.id3.frames.ImageFrame.FRONT_COVER

audiofile = eyed3.load(file_name)
IMAGES = audiofile.tag.images
IMAGES.set(FRONT_COVER, image_data, mime_type, u"")

audiofile.tag.save(encoding='utf-8', version=eyed3.id3.ID3_V2_4)
```

That code saves the APIC tag (picture) with ISO-8859-1, but if the `set` funciton is as follow:
`IMAGES.set(FRONT_COVER, image_data, mime_type, u"description")` then the image field is indeed saved with UTF-8

I should say that I was using Ubuntu 16.04 which came with eyeD3 v0.6.18, that version (using python2) didn't have this bug. I've just upgraded to Ubuntu 18.04 and found this bug when updating my scripts to the new version

items.title: eyeD3 not setting exit code different than 0 when running --write-images on a file with no images
items.body:
I've just bumped into this while testing `--write-images` on a file without any images: if eyeD3 hits an error and outputs an error message to indicate it, it still sets the exit code to 0. So, we can't use eyeD3's exit code to check whether the operation was successful or not.

To reproduce it:

1. Create a dummy empty ID3 file: `touch foo.id3`
1. Try to show its tags with `eyeD3 foo.id3`, and immediately afterwards show the exit code:
    ```
    +paulo@monk:~/tmp$ eyeD3 foo.id3; echo $?
    /home/paulo/tmp/foo.id3                                                           [ 0.00 Bytes ]
    -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    No ID3 v1.x/v2.x tag found!
    0
    ```

I'm running latest eyeD3 from master (b8aa2c320dbcf22059fc9d132b832f5f8e28543a) on Xubuntu 17.10.

items.title: --quiet --write-images doesn't write images, but --write-images alone does
items.body:
I was testing a script that extracts images from audio files, so, for MP3 files, I used:

```
eyeD3 --no-color --write-images . foo.mp3
```

and the image was correctly written to the current directory. However, when I added `--quiet`:

```
eyeD3 --quiet --no-color --write-images . foo.mp3
```

the image was not written.

To reproduce it:

1. Get any JPG file, rename it to _cover.jpg_
1. Create a dummy ID3 file:
    `touch foo.id3`
1. Add _cover.jpg_ to it:
    `eyeD3 --add-image cover.jpg:FRONT_COVER foo.id3`
1. Try to extract it with `--quiet`:
    `eyeD3 --quiet --write-images . foo.id3`
    The image **will not** be written.
1. Try to extract it without `--quiet`:
    `eyeD3 --write-images . foo.id3`
    The image **will** be written.

items.title: Is it possible to set PRIV fames?
items.body:
Is it possible to set a PRIV frame using the eyeD3 command line?

The [HLS specification](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8216#section-3.4) states that:

>    Each Packed Audio Segment MUST signal the timestamp of its first
>    sample with an ID3 Private frame (PRIV) tag [ID3] at the beginning of
>    the segment.  The ID3 PRIV owner identifier MUST be
>    "com.apple.streaming.transportStreamTimestamp".  The ID3 payload MUST
>    be a 33-bit MPEG-2 Program Elementary Stream timestamp expressed as a
>    big-endian eight-octet number, with the upper 31 bits set to zero.
>    Clients SHOULD NOT play Packed Audio Segments without this ID3 tag.


I have tried using `--text-frame` - but I guess it wants the frame to start with a 'T'?

```
~/Projects/wav-to-hls $ eyeD3 hls/1560E29B_000125.mp3 --text-frame PRIV:foo:bar
Setting PRIV text frame to 'foo:bar'
Invalid frame-id for text frame
```

> Traceback (most recent call last):

What is the problem?

items.title: Renaming files with multiple artists
items.body:
Hi. According to the ID3 spec 

> The 'Lead artist(s)/Lead performer(s)/Soloist(s)/Performing group' is used for the main artist(s). They are seperated with the "/" character.

If I do this:

```python
from eyed3.id3.tag import TagTemplate
import eyed3

audio_file = eyed3.load('test.mp3')
# clear any existing tags
audio_file.initTag()

tag = audio_file.tag
tag.artist = 'A/B'
tag.title = 'foobar'

new_name = TagTemplate('$artist - $title').substitute(tag, zeropad=True) # A-B - foobar

audio_file.rename(new_name)
```
I end up with: `A-B - foobar.mp3`. The artists are set properly in the tag, and are correctly listed as individuals. The '/' characters are getting replaced so as to not cause path issues and while that's a good general fix, I think the relatively common case of multiple artists warrants independent handling.

In particular, I would like to see this being the result of the above code: `A, B - foobar`, with a comma delimiter between artists.

Thanks for the awesome library and tool!

items.title: fcntl not defined (for Win 10/64) for console.py
items.body:
installed eyed3 0.8.4 on Win 10/64, python 3.6.3 with libmagic dlls (and maybe there's the problem) but just running eyed3 somefile.mp3 throws an exception
`
  File "c:\users\billh\appdata\local\programs\python\python36\lib\site-packages\eyed3\utils\console.py", line 500, in getTtySize
    data = fcntl.ioctl(fd, termios.TIOCGWINSZ, '\0' * 4)
NameError: name 'fcntl' is not defined
`
as fcntl isn't defined under Windows (at least with the libraries here...), but happily:

adding NameError to the exceptions list for that try in eyed3\utils\console.py fixes the problem, allowing the pass and fallthru to the other console size tests:
`
    if check_tty:
        try:
            data = fcntl.ioctl(fd, termios.TIOCGWINSZ, '\0' * 4)
            hw = struct.unpack("hh", data)
        except (OSError, IOError, NameError):
            pass
`

items.title: configure; make; make install
items.body: Please make it again available compiling the project by "configure; make; make install".

items.title: dangerous auto-recursive
items.body: When applying eyeD3 to a folder without any switch, it finds and acts recursively on all subfolders and files, which is not normally expected and may lead to unwanted results specially when used with --remove switch. I suggest make a -r or -R switch mandatory for this type of action.

items.title: Removing comments doesn't work
items.body:
Hello,

I'd like to remove comments using the python3 interface of eyed3 (v0.8.0):

	audiofile = eyed3.load("somefile.mp3")
	for comment in audiofile.tag.comments:
		# Show comment
		print(comment.description)
		print(comment.text)
		print(comment.lang)

		# Remove comment. Doesn't work with empty descriptions.
		audiofile.tag.comments.remove(comment.description)

The comment is correctly printed (text & lang). The description is an empty string.
But calling remove returns None and doesn't remove the comment.

items.title: eyeD3 destroys m4a files
items.body:
I used eye3D from the command-line to fix a series of tags in a batch. Some of them were m4a with aac audio. It is far from obvious from eye3D's description that this kind of file is not supported. More importantly, eye3D does not simply fail to operate. Instead, the file is damaged so the contents cannot be played any more. **This should never ever happen.** I suggest displaying an error message instead.

I use Ubuntu 16.04. eye3D is executed with Python 3.5.2. Issue exists in eyeD3

items.title: convert eyed3.compat to six
no need for ord() on Python 3
items.body:
Seems [this](https://github.com/nicfit/eyeD3/blob/master/src/eyed3/mp3/headers.py#L314) always breaks for me on Python 3! How do you work with that? I never get it to work. Only in Python 2.7x

This line gets an index from a bytes object and is already the integer then. Asking it for ord() breaks:
```
  File "C:\Python36\lib\site-packages\eyed3\mp3\headers.py", line 311, in decode
    version = (ord(frame[1]) >> 3) & 0x1
TypeError: ord() expected string of length 1, but int found
```

Apperently its a Python 3 feature. We could implement something like
```
def _ordinal(one_char_string):
    if isinstance(one_char_string, int):
        return one_char_string
    else:
        return ord(one_char_string)
```
But maybe this should be just different code when got from pip for Python 3 like?:
```
    def decode(self, frame):
        # mp3 version
        version = (_frame[1] >> 3) & 0x1
```
But wait a second... It doesn't even work then! Doesn't even complain! `.tag` is of type `None` then.
Aaaahhhh! Is this something that release 0.8.0 is fixing!? When will it be in?
